intro: Lethedon setosa, commonly known as the hairy lethedon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its common name. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
